results.name: Sparse ruler statistics: T(n,k) (0 <= k <= n) is the number of rulers with length n where the length of the first segment appears k times. Triangle read by rows.
comment: A sparse ruler, or simply a ruler, is a strict increasing finite sequence of nonnegative integers starting from 0 called marks. See A103294 for more definitions.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..200, flattened
formula: Sum_{k=1..n} k * T(n,k) = A175656(n-1) for n>0. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 07 2020
